channel.title: [Pi] Clipping Error [Pi]
channel.description:
Hey guys, I followed one of the clipping tutorials, and whenever you attack an npc and run away/teleport, this error appears in the run cmd prompt.
[code][1/10/14 9:19 PM]: java.lang.NullPointerException [1/10/14 9:19 PM]: at server.Region.getClipping(Region.java:249) [1/10/14 9:19 PM]: at server.model.npcs.NPCHandler.handleClipping(NPCHandle r.java:1722) [1/10/14 9:19 PM]: at server.model.npcs.NPCHandler.followPlayer(NPCHandler. java:1698) [1/10/14 9:19 PM]: at server.model.npcs.NPCHandler.process(NPCHandler.java: 954) [1/10/14 9:19 PM]: at server.Server.main(Server.java:179) [1/10/14 9:19 PM]: A fatal exception has been thrown! [1/10/14 9:19 PM]: Saved game for Brent. Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
I get this error whenever I replace
[code] if (checkClipping(i)) npcs[i].getNextNPCMovement(i); else { npcs[i].moveX = 0; npcs[i].moveY = 0; }[/code]
With
[code] handleClipping(i); npcs[i].getNextNPCMovement(i);[/code]
In NPCHandler. I tried altering the original code and adding handleClipping(i) into it but the same error comes up. So it's the handleClipping(i) statement that is causing the error. Any ideas on how to fix?

item.title: [Pi] Clipping Error [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @b00mz1029 b00mz1029
item.description:
